title: Greek Vegetables

ingredients.content: 4 oz green cabbage, cut into 2 in. pieces, divided
4 oz fresh baby kale leaves, cut into 2 in. pieces, divided
2 oz carrots, cut into 1 in. pieces
1 poblano chili, stem and seeds removed
4 oz Brussels sprouts, trimmed, if large cut in quarters
3 oz extra virgin olive oil, divided
4 oz broccoli raab, cut into 4 in. pieces, divided
½ oz fresh oregano, leaves only, to taste
2 oz feta cheese, crumbled, to serve

preparations.content: Place garlic, parsnips, 2 oz cabbage, 2 oz baby kale, carrots, poblano chili, Brussels sprouts, tomatoes, tomato paste, 1 oz olive oil, 2 oz broccoli raab, zucchini, eggplant, oregano and salt into mixing bowl and cook <b>10 min/212°F//speed 1<b>.
Add remaining baby kale, broccoli raab, cabbage and fennel and cook <b>20 min/185°F//speed 1<b>.
Transfer into serving dish, pour 2 oz olive oil over the top, sprinkle with feta cheese and serve.

hintsAndTricks: Use any vegetables you like, even lettuce leaves work well. Use garlic, oregano and olive oil liberally as these are a vital part of the dish.

Broccoli raab is truly a vegetable with many names around the world.  A few of the many names are raab, rabe, rapa, rapine, rappi, rappone, fall and spring raab, turnip broccoli, taitcat, Italian or Chinese broccoli, broccoli rape, broccoli de rabe, Italian turnip, and turnip broccoli.
For best flavor: use a high quality extra virgin olive oil in this dish.
Serve with orzo pasta or pita bread.
